agenda: Outline data sources feeding the SOP

transcript.speaker: Lan
transcript.utterance: Thanks for joining. Today we lock the SOP scope for SecureScribe's enterprise onboarding playbook.

transcript.speaker: Bao
transcript.utterance: Customer success needs the SOP to cover intake through executive readout, with templates for kickoff emails and weekly status.

transcript.speaker: Minh
transcript.utterance: Implementation can supply meeting transcripts, Jira epics, and configuration runbooks. We need final sign-off on which repositories we mirror.

transcript.speaker: Sofia
transcript.utterance: Security wants SOC 2 evidence pulled from Drata plus the privileged access checklist. Anything classified as Restricted stays in the enclave, so reference links are safer than raw exports.

transcript.speaker: Lan
transcript.utterance: Great. We'll scope data sources to: kickoff questionnaire responses, Gong discovery calls, Jira onboarding board, and Drata control evidence.

transcript.speaker: Liam
transcript.utterance: Marketing can repurpose the executive-readout section for case studies as long as we scrub client names. We also promised enablement decks by December 5th.

transcript.speaker: Minh
transcript.utterance: Timeline proposal: draft SOP outline by Nov 25, stakeholder review Nov 27, pilot with the FinServe cluster starting Dec 2, and org-wide release Dec 9.

transcript.speaker: Bao
transcript.utterance: Dependencies: need the updated escalation matrix from support, plus the AI redaction policy from compliance.

transcript.speaker: Sofia
transcript.utterance: I'll deliver the redaction policy draft tomorrow. Also reminding everyone that privileged recordings must be tagged before uploading so the retrieval layer honors the security filter.

transcript.speaker: Lan
transcript.utterance: Action items: Minh owns the outline, Bao handles templates, Sofia secures the policy, Liam preps enablement messaging, and I'll run executive alignment.

transcript.speaker: Lan
transcript.utterance: Success looks like onboarding teams reusing a single SOP with meeting notes auto-attached per customer so CS can search their history without rebuilding summaries.
